DOC.brief_summary: The aim trial evaluate effectiveness coronally advanced flap ( CAF ) +connective tissue graft ( CTG ) +platelet-rich fibrin ( PRF ) combination Miller I II recession treatment compare CAF+CTG . 40 patient surgically treat either CAF+CTG+PRF ( test group ) CAF+CTG ( control group ) . Clinical parameter plaque index ( PI ) , gingival index ( GI ) , vertical recession ( VR ) , probe depth ( PD ) , attachment level ( AL ) , keratinize tissue width ( KTW ) , horizontal recession ( HR ) , MGJ localization ( L-MGJ ) , tissue thickness ( TT ) record baseline , 3 month ( PS1 ) 6 month ( PS2 ) post-surgery . Root coverage ( RC ) , complete RC ( CRC ) , attachment gain ( AG ) , keratinize tissue change ( KTC ) also calculate .
DOC.brief_title: Platelet-rich Fibrin Connective Tissue Graft Recession Treatment
DOC.criteria: Systemically healthy Single Miller type I II recession defect ≥ 3 mm localize anterior/premolar area No alveolar bone loss Identifiable cementoenamel junction Probing depth ≤3mm Smoking Pregnancy History periodontal surgery last two year Mobility Excessive occlusal contact Caries Loss vitality
